member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.CreateGroupRequest.GroupName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property GroupName.
The case-sensitive name of the new group. Default is a reserved name and names must be unique.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.CreateGroupRequest.InsightsConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InsightsConfiguration.
The structure containing configurations related to insights.
The InsightsEnabled boolean can be set to true to enable insights for the new group or false to disable insights for the new group.
The NotifcationsEnabled boolean can be set to true to enable insights notifications for the new group. Notifications may only be enabled on a group with InsightsEnabled set to true.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.CreateGroupRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A map that contains one or more tag keys and tag values to attach to an X-Ray group. For more information about ways to use tags, see Tagging Amazon Web Services resources in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.
The following restrictions apply to tags:
Maximum number of user-applied tags per resource: 50
Maximum tag key length: 128 Unicode characters
Maximum tag value length: 256 Unicode characters
Valid values for key and value: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, space, and the following characters: _ . : / = + - and @
Tag keys and values are case sensitive.
Don't use aws: as a prefix for keys; it's reserved for Amazon Web Services use.

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.Model.CreateGroupResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateGroup operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.CreateGroupResponse.Group
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Group.
The group that was created. Contains the name of the group that was created, the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the group that was generated based on the group name, the filter expression, and the insight configuration that was assigned to the group.

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.Model.CreateSamplingRuleRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateSamplingRule operation. Creates a rule to control sampling behavior for instrumented applications. Services retrieve rules with GetSamplingRules, and evaluate each rule in ascending order of priority for each request. If a rule matches, the service records a trace, borrowing it from the reservoir size. After 10 seconds, the service reports back to X-Ray with GetSamplingTargets to get updated versions of each in-use rule. The updated rule contains a trace quota that the service can use instead of borrowing from the reservoir.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.CreateSamplingRuleRequest.SamplingRule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SamplingRule.
The rule definition.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.CreateSamplingRuleRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A map that contains one or more tag keys and tag values to attach to an X-Ray sampling rule. For more information about ways to use tags, see Tagging Amazon Web Services resources in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.
The following restrictions apply to tags:
Maximum number of user-applied tags per resource: 50
Maximum tag key length: 128 Unicode characters
Maximum tag value length: 256 Unicode characters
Valid values for key and value: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, space, and the following characters: _ . : / = + - and @
Tag keys and values are case sensitive.
Don't use aws: as a prefix for keys; it's reserved for Amazon Web Services use.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.CreateSamplingRuleResponse.SamplingRuleRecord
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SamplingRuleRecord.
The saved rule definition and metadata.

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.Model.GetServiceGraphRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetServiceGraph operation. Downstream services can be other applications, Amazon Web Services resources, HTTP web APIs, or SQL databases.

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.Model.GetTraceSummariesRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetTraceSummaries operation. Retrieves IDs and annotations for traces available for a specified time frame using an optional filter. To get the full traces, pass the trace IDs to BatchGetTraces.
A filter expression can target traced requests that hit specific service nodes or edges, have errors, or come from a known user. For example, the following filter expression targets traces that pass through api.example.com:
service("api.example.com")
This filter expression finds traces that have an annotation named account with the value 12345:
annotation.account = "12345"
For a full list of indexed fields and keywords that you can use in filter expressions, see Using Filter Expressions in the Amazon Web Services X-Ray Developer Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.Model.PutEncryptionConfigRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the PutEncryptionConfig operation. Updates the encryption configuration for X-Ray data.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.PutEncryptionConfigRequest.KeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KeyId.
An Amazon Web Services KMS key in one of the following formats:
Alias - The name of the key. For example, alias/MyKey.
Key ID - The KMS key ID of the key. For example, ae4aa6d49-a4d8-9df9-a475-4ff6d7898456. Amazon Web Services X-Ray does not support asymmetric KMS keys.
ARN - The full Amazon Resource Name of the key ID or alias. For example, arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:123456789012:key/ae4aa6d49-a4d8-9df9-a475-4ff6d7898456. Use this format to specify a key in a different account.
Omit this key if you set Type to NONE.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.PutEncryptionConfigRequest.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of encryption. Set to KMS to use your own key for encryption. Set to NONE for default encryption.

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.Model.Segment
member.summary:
A segment from a trace that has been ingested by the X-Ray service. The segment can be compiled from documents uploaded with PutTraceSegments, or an inferred segment for a downstream service, generated from a subsegment sent by the service that called it.
For the full segment document schema, see Amazon Web Services X-Ray Segment Documents in the Amazon Web Services X-Ray Developer Guide.

Amazon Web Services Service - The type of an Amazon Web Services service. For example, AWS::DynamoDB for downstream calls to Amazon DynamoDB that didn't target a specific table.

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.Model.Tag
member.summary:
A map that contains tag keys and tag values to attach to an Amazon Web Services X-Ray group or sampling rule. For more information about ways to use tags, see Tagging Amazon Web Services resources in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.
The following restrictions apply to tags:
Maximum number of user-applied tags per resource: 50
Tag keys and values are case sensitive.
Don't use aws: as a prefix for keys; it's reserved for Amazon Web Services use. You cannot edit or delete system tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.Tag.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
A tag key, such as Stage or Name. A tag key cannot be empty. The key can be a maximum of 128 characters, and can contain only Unicode letters, numbers, or separators, or the following special characters: + - = . _ : /

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.Tag.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
An optional tag value, such as Production or test-only. The value can be a maximum of 255 characters, and contain only Unicode letters, numbers, or separators, or the following special characters: + - = . _ : /

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.Model.TagResourceRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the TagResource operation. Applies tags to an existing Amazon Web Services X-Ray group or sampling rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.TagResourceRequest.ResourceARN
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceARN.
The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of an X-Ray group or sampling rule.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.Model.TagResourceRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A map that contains one or more tag keys and tag values to attach to an X-Ray group or sampling rule. For more information about ways to use tags, see Tagging Amazon Web Services resources in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.
The following restrictions apply to tags:
Maximum number of user-applied tags per resource: 50
Maximum tag key length: 128 Unicode characters
Maximum tag value length: 256 Unicode characters
Valid values for key and value: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, space, and the following characters: _ . : / = + - and @
Tag keys and values are case sensitive.
Don't use aws: as a prefix for keys; it's reserved for Amazon Web Services use. You cannot edit or delete system tags.

member.name: T:Amazon.XRay.AmazonXRayClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing XRay
Amazon Web Services X-Ray provides APIs for managing debug traces and retrieving service maps and other data created by processing those traces.

member.name: P:Amazon.XRay.AmazonXRayClient.Paginators
member.summary: Paginators for the service

member.name: M:Amazon.XRay.AmazonXRayClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonXRayClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.XRay.AmazonXRayClient.CreateSamplingRule(Amazon.XRay.Model.CreateSamplingRuleRequest)
member.summary: Creates a rule to control sampling behavior for instrumented applications. Services retrieve rules with GetSamplingRules, and evaluate each rule in ascending order of priority for each request. If a rule matches, the service records a trace, borrowing it from the reservoir size. After 10 seconds, the service reports back to X-Ray with GetSamplingTargets to get updated versions of each in-use rule. The updated rule contains a trace quota that the service can use instead of borrowing from the reservoir.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateSamplingRule service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateSamplingRule service method, as returned by XRay.
member.exception: The request is missing required parameters or has invalid parameters.
You have reached the maximum number of sampling rules.
The request exceeds the maximum number of requests per second.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateSamplingRule Operation

member.summary: Creates a rule to control sampling behavior for instrumented applications. Services retrieve rules with GetSamplingRules, and evaluate each rule in ascending order of priority for each request. If a rule matches, the service records a trace, borrowing it from the reservoir size. After 10 seconds, the service reports back to X-Ray with GetSamplingTargets to get updated versions of each in-use rule. The updated rule contains a trace quota that the service can use instead of borrowing from the reservoir.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateSamplingRule service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the CreateSamplingRule service method, as returned by XRay.

member.name: M:Amazon.XRay.AmazonXRayClient.GetTraceSummaries(Amazon.XRay.Model.GetTraceSummariesRequest)
member.summary:
Retrieves IDs and annotations for traces available for a specified time frame using an optional filter. To get the full traces, pass the trace IDs to BatchGetTraces.
A filter expression can target traced requests that hit specific service nodes or edges, have errors, or come from a known user. For example, the following filter expression targets traces that pass through api.example.com:
service("api.example.com")
This filter expression finds traces that have an annotation named account with the value 12345:
annotation.account = "12345"
For a full list of indexed fields and keywords that you can use in filter expressions, see Using Filter Expressions in the Amazon Web Services X-Ray Developer Guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetTraceSummaries service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetTraceSummaries service method, as returned by XRay.
member.exception: The request is missing required parameters or has invalid parameters.
The request exceeds the maximum number of requests per second.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetTraceSummaries Operation

This filter expression finds traces that have an annotation named account with the value 12345:

member.name: M:Amazon.XRay.IAmazonXRay.CreateSamplingRule(Amazon.XRay.Model.CreateSamplingRuleRequest)
member.summary: Creates a rule to control sampling behavior for instrumented applications. Services retrieve rules with GetSamplingRules, and evaluate each rule in ascending order of priority for each request. If a rule matches, the service records a trace, borrowing it from the reservoir size. After 10 seconds, the service reports back to X-Ray with GetSamplingTargets to get updated versions of each in-use rule. The updated rule contains a trace quota that the service can use instead of borrowing from the reservoir.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateSamplingRule service method.
member.returns: The response from the CreateSamplingRule service method, as returned by XRay.
member.exception: The request is missing required parameters or has invalid parameters.
You have reached the maximum number of sampling rules.
The request exceeds the maximum number of requests per second.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CreateSamplingRule Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.XRay.IAmazonXRay.GetTraceSummaries(Amazon.XRay.Model.GetTraceSummariesRequest)
member.summary:
Retrieves IDs and annotations for traces available for a specified time frame using an optional filter. To get the full traces, pass the trace IDs to BatchGetTraces.
A filter expression can target traced requests that hit specific service nodes or edges, have errors, or come from a known user. For example, the following filter expression targets traces that pass through api.example.com:
service("api.example.com")
This filter expression finds traces that have an annotation named account with the value 12345:
annotation.account = "12345"
For a full list of indexed fields and keywords that you can use in filter expressions, see Using Filter Expressions in the Amazon Web Services X-Ray Developer Guide.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetTraceSummaries service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetTraceSummaries service method, as returned by XRay.
member.exception: The request is missing required parameters or has invalid parameters.
The request exceeds the maximum number of requests per second.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetTraceSummaries Operation

This filter expression finds traces that have an annotation named account with the value 12345:

For a full list of indexed fields and keywords that you can use in filter expressions, see Using Filter Expressions in the Amazon Web Services X-Ray Developer Guide.
